documentation.text:
@title Provides addresses of the live contracts implementing certain interfaces.
 @dev Examples of interfaces with implementations that Finder locates are the Oracle and Store interfaces.

@title Provides addresses of the live contracts implementing certain interfaces.
 @dev Examples of interfaces with implementations that Finder locates are the Oracle and Store interfaces.

devdoc.details: Examples of interfaces with implementations that Finder locates are the Oracle and Store interfaces.

params.interfaceName: bytes32 of the interface name that is either changed or registered.

returns._0: implementationAddress address of the defined interface.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Provides addresses of the live contracts implementing certain interfaces.

changeImplementationAddress(bytes32,addr.notice: Updates the address of the contract that implements `interfaceName`.

getImplementationAddress(bytes32).notice: Gets the address of the contract that implements the given `interfaceName`.
